title: Epic: Phase 4 - Cross-repo auto-discovery
description: Implement repo scanning from configured roots and --all mode to list/switch across repositories.
close_reason: Implemented Phase 4 features: auto-discovery, cross-repo list/interactive, and README

title: Task: README + shell integration docs
description: Document installation, required deps (git/fzf), shell wrapper function, and common workflows.
close_reason: Implemented Phase 4 features: auto-discovery, cross-repo list/interactive, and README

title: Task: implement wt preview
description: Implement 'wt preview --path PATH' that prints repo/branch/path + status summary (git status -sb) + recent commits + changed files summary.
close_reason: implemented wt preview with git status/log/changed files

title: Improve --help text for agent discoverability
description:
Enhance --help output to be more useful for agents discovering the CLI.

Improvements:
- Add examples in help text
- Document JSON output formats in command help
- Ensure all flags are well-documented
- Add see-also references between related commands
- Consider adding 'wt help <topic>' for detailed docs

Good help text enables agents to learn the CLI without external docs.

title: Add shell completions (zsh, bash, fish)
description:
Generate shell completions for all wt commands and subcommands.

Use clap's built-in completion generation to support:
- zsh completions
- bash completions  
- fish completions

Completions should cover all subcommands and flags.
close_reason: Shell completions included in 'wt init' output for all three shells

title: Task: wt prune
description: Implement 'wt prune' calling 'git worktree prune' (and optional stale listing).
close_reason: Implemented in this session

title: Task: config read/write skeleton
description: Implement config loading/saving at config dir. Support editor + autoDiscovery paths + fzf defaults.
close_reason: Implemented in this session

title: Implement interactive 'wt init' that auto-detects shell and offers to add integration to config file
close_reason: Implemented interactive shell setup - wt init now auto-detects shell and offers to modify config file

title: Add binary releases via GitHub Actions
description:
Set up automated binary releases for multiple platforms.

Targets:
- macOS (x86_64 and aarch64)
- Linux (x86_64, aarch64)
- Windows (x86_64)

Use cargo-dist or goreleaser-style workflow to:
- Build on tag push
- Create GitHub releases with binaries
- Generate checksums

close_reason: Phase 1 complete: CLI skeleton, porcelain parsing, git runner, config, list all implemented

description: Implement wt list/add/remove/prune/config and ensure safe UX.
close_reason: Phase 3 complete: add, remove, prune, config commands all implemented

title: Task: add --all cross-repo interactive
description: Implement `wt --all` interactive picker. Candidate format should include repo name + branch + path.
close_reason: Implemented Phase 4 features: auto-discovery, cross-repo list/interactive, and README

title: Task: wt config commands
description: Implement 'wt config init/show/set-editor/set-discovery-paths' per ARCHITECTURE.md.
close_reason: Implemented in this session

title: Task: implement wt interactive
description: Implement interactive picker command: run fzf, show candidates, return action output like 'cd|PATH' or 'edit|PATH'.
close_reason: Implemented in this session

title: Task: implement repository auto-discovery scanner
description:
Scan configured roots (depth-limited) to locate git repositories.

Handle both:
- `.git/` directories
- `.git` files (common in worktrees/submodules)

Return discovered repo roots (deduped).
close_reason: Implemented Phase 4 features: auto-discovery, cross-repo list/interactive, and README

title: Epic: Standalone binary with shell integration built-in
description:
Make wt a standalone binary that doesn't require shell wrappers. Users should be able to install via homebrew and have cd functionality work out of the box.

Key requirements:
- Eliminate need for shell wrapper function
- Support installation via homebrew (macOS) and other package managers
- Binary should handle shell integration automatically
- Simple 'brew install wt' should give full functionality

Inspiration: Tools like 'z' or 'zoxide' that handle shell integration elegantly.

title: Task: bootstrap Rust CLI project
description: Create Cargo project for wt/wtm binary. Add deps: clap, anyhow, serde, serde_json, directories. Add basic command structure and --version.
close_reason: cargo project initialized; clap CLI skeleton and deps added

title: Add --quiet flag for non-interactive operation
description:
Add --quiet flag to commands that have interactive prompts.

Commands affected:
- wt remove (has confirmation prompt)
- wt config init (could have prompts)

The --quiet flag should:
- Suppress informational messages
- Skip confirmation prompts (assume yes)
- Only output essential data (errors, JSON output)

This allows agents to use commands without handling interactive prompts.

title: Task: tests for porcelain parsing
description: Add unit tests with fixture outputs for `git worktree list --porcelain` parsing edge cases (detached HEAD, locked, prunable, bare, missing branch).
close_reason: Already have tests covering detached HEAD, locked, prunable, bare in worktree.rs

title: Task: wt remove worktree
description: Implement 'wt remove' with confirmation (unless --force). Call 'git worktree remove'.
close_reason: Implemented in this session

title: Task: implement wt list (per-repo)
description: Implement `wt list` for current repo (pretty + --json). Uses porcelain parser.
close_reason: Implemented wt list per-repo with pretty and json output

title: Epic: Agent-friendly CLI design
description:
Make wt as compatible and useful for AI agents as possible, following patterns from beads (bd).

Key principles from beads:
- JSON output for all commands (--json flag)
- Clear, parseable output formats
- Comprehensive --help text
- AGENTS.md file with workflow instructions
- Commands designed for programmatic use
- Minimal interactive prompts (or --quiet flags)

Reference: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads

title: Set up Homebrew formula for distribution
description:
Create Homebrew formula for easy macOS installation.

Requirements:
- Create homebrew tap repository or submit to homebrew-core
- Formula should build from source or download prebuilt binary
- Include post-install message about shell init
- Test on Intel and Apple Silicon Macs

Usage goal: brew install wt

title: Implement 'wt init' shell integration command
description:
Add 'wt init <shell>' command that outputs shell code for integration.

Usage pattern:
  eval "$(wt init zsh)"    # in ~/.zshrc
  eval "$(wt init bash)"   # in ~/.bashrc
  wt init fish | source      # in ~/.config/fish/config.fish

The init command should:
- Output minimal shell function that wraps wt
- Handle cd/edit action parsing
- Support zsh, bash, fish shells
- Include shell completions
close_reason: Implemented 'wt init <shell>' with shell wrapper functions and completions for zsh, bash, fish

title: Task: add --all cross-repo list
description: Implement `wt list --all` to aggregate worktrees across discovered repos (and --json).
close_reason: Implemented Phase 4 features: auto-discovery, cross-repo list/interactive, and README

title: Add --json flag to all commands
description:
Ensure all wt commands support --json output for programmatic use by agents.

Commands to update:
- wt list (already has --json)
- wt add → output created worktree info as JSON
- wt remove → output removed worktree info as JSON  
- wt prune → output pruned worktrees as JSON
- wt config show (output as JSON by default)
- wt interactive → consider JSON action output

JSON should include all relevant fields and be consistently structured.

title: Epic: worktree-manager v0.1
description: Deliver first usable version of wt (rust + git + fzf) with per-repo interactive switching and basic management commands, plus optional cross-repo auto-discovery support.
close_reason: v0.1 complete: all phases implemented (CLI skeleton, interactive mode, management commands, cross-repo discovery)

title: Task: parse git worktree porcelain
description:
Parse `git worktree list --porcelain` output into Rust structs (path, branch, head, bare, locked, prunable, etc.).

Acceptance:
- Parser handles multiple worktrees
- Branch may be missing (detached HEAD)
- Output is round-trippable in tests
close_reason: added porcelain parser + basic unit tests

title: Add machine-readable error output
description:
Ensure errors are machine-parseable for agent error handling.

Requirements:
- Consistent error format (consider JSON errors with --json)
- Clear exit codes for different error types
- Structured error messages (not just prose)
- Error categories: user_error, not_found, git_error, config_error

This allows agents to programmatically handle and recover from errors.

description: Spawn external fzf, feed candidates via stdin, capture selected line. Support preview command invocation.
close_reason: Implemented in this session

description: Implement 'wt add BRANCH' (optional -p PATH, --track REMOTE). Decide default path naming convention.
close_reason: Implemented in this session

title: Epic: Phase 2 - Interactive wt via fzf
description: Implement interactive picker using external fzf + rich preview via wt preview.

title: Create comprehensive AGENTS.md for wt
description:
Create an AGENTS.md file following the beads pattern to guide AI agents.

Should include:
- Project overview and purpose
- Quick command reference
- Workflow examples for common tasks
- Best practices for agent usage
- JSON output documentation
- Error handling guidance
- Integration tips

Reference beads AGENTS.md: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/AGENTS.md

title: Implement worktree-manager CLI tool
description:
Build a CLI tool that manages git worktrees for the current repository.

Key features:
- wt (interactive): fzf-based picker for switching between worktrees
- wt list: List all worktrees for current repo
- wt add <branch>: Create new worktree
- wt remove <worktree>: Remove worktree
- wt config: Manage configuration

See DESIGN.md for full specification.
close_reason: v0.1 complete: all phases implemented (CLI skeleton, interactive mode, management commands, cross-repo discovery)

title: Research shell integration patterns (zoxide, starship)
description:
Research how tools like zoxide, starship, and similar handle shell integration elegantly.

Goals:
- Understand how zoxide provides 'cd' functionality without wrappers
- Study starship's init command pattern
- Document options: eval-based init, shell plugin, completions
- Recommend best approach for wt
close_reason: Research complete - implemented zoxide-style eval pattern
